name: places/ChIJ9dYpCSP9ZUARNtV-xOcvavo

displayName.text: Consulate of the Republic of Singapore

formattedAddress: 318 E 48th St, New York, NY 10017, USA
adrFormatAddress: 318 E 48th St, New York, NY 10017, USA

originalText.text: Went to caste my vote today. The process was super efficient. Everyone was nice and the guided thru the process. There was no line and was in and out in few minutes. Kudos to team Singapore consulate.

text.text: Went to caste my vote today. The process was super efficient. Everyone was nice and the guided thru the process. There was no line and was in and out in few minutes. Kudos to team Singapore consulate.

originalText.text: I applied for a passport online and went to the consulate to get it. Initially, after my passport was approved, nobody reached out to me about when I could go to get it. I had to email the consulate to ask and I did get a reply within a day. The staff was efficient and polite when I went there to get my passport. My only complaint is that they didn't allow me to use the restroom. I had traveled 2 hrs to get to the consulate. I think they shouldn't be so petty about this.

text.text: I applied for a passport online and went to the consulate to get it. Initially, after my passport was approved, nobody reached out to me about when I could go to get it. My only complaint is that they didn't allow me to use the restroom. I had traveled 2 hrs to get to the consulate. I think they shouldn't be so petty about this.

originalText.text: I had a very bad experience making contact with the staff. Three emails were sent, and none of them were replied until now. Two more phone calls were made afterwards. The staff member who answered the phone was not helpful or cooperative at all and hanged off the phone impatiently before I could finish speaking. I understand that there could be much work to do for them, but that's no excuse for mistreating the clients like this.

text.text: I had a very bad experience making contact with the staff. Three emails were sent, and none of them were replied until now. Two more phone calls were made afterwards. The staff member who answered the phone was not helpful or cooperative at all and hanged off the phone impatiently before I could finish speaking. I understand that there could be much work to do for them, but that's no excuse for mistreating the clients like this.

originalText.text: I need a travel visa for a super long layover. I went in at opening time hoping to get it done before my work. I left plenty of time, and to my surprise, I was in an out under 8 minutes. There is no line and everyone was very nice and efficient. I actually arrived one minute early and saw employees walked into the secured door while I was waiting outside. Each one offered to help me. Holding a not so powerful passport, I have been to many consulates and obtained many many visas.  This one is very small, but by far the best. It truly deserves a five star.

originalText.text: This was the first consulate/embassy that I’ve been to where the experience was actively positive. Like the Singaporean government in general, the consulate was efficiently run and highly competent. I received an email reply within 5 minutes of sending an email requesting an appointment. The consul-general was very friendly and greeted visitors with a big smile — this is how every consulate should be! A consulate is like the face of a foreign government and the Singaporean consulate in NYC has definitely excelled in doing just that. The staff even apologized for the “long wait” when the wait was nothing compared to that at many other consulate-like places (plus I was early for my appointment to begin with)! The security staff were friendly too. Anyway, overall very pleasant experience :) Makes me miss Singapore :S
